<div id="readme" class="md" data-path="README.md"><article class="markdown-body entry-content container-lg" itemprop="text"><h1><a id="user-content-stochasticsemidiscretizationmethodjl" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#stochasticsemidiscretizationmethodjl"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>StochasticSemiDiscretizationMethod.jl</h1>
<p>Julia package to investigate the behaviour of the first and second moments of stochastic linear delay differential equations based on the paper
[1] <a href="https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1002/nme.6076" rel="nofollow">Stochastic semi‚Äêdiscretization for linear stochastic delay differential equations</a> and the book
[2] <a href="http://link.springer.com/10.1007/978-1-4614-0335-7" rel="nofollow">Semi-Discretization for Time-Delay Systems (by Insperger and Stepan)</a>.</p>
<p>This package provides a tool to approximate the stability properties and stationary behaviour of linear periodic delay systems of the form:</p>

<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://camo.githubusercontent."><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent." title="$$\mathrm{d} \mathbf{x}(t) = \left(\mathbf{A} \mathbf{x}(t) + \sum_{j=1}^g \mathbf{B}_j \mathbf{x}(t-\tau_j)+\mathbf{c}\right)\mathrm{d}t + \sum_{k=1}^w\left(\boldsymbol{\alpha}^k \mathbf{x}(t) + \sum_{j=1}^g \boldsymbol{\beta}^k_j \mathbf{x}(t-\tau_j) + \boldsymbol{\sigma}^k \right)\mathrm{d}W^k(t)$$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$$\mathrm{d}&amp;space;\mathbf{x}(t)&amp;space;=&amp;space;\left(\mathbf{A}&amp;space;\mathbf{x}(t)&amp;space;+&amp;space;\sum_{j=1}^g&amp;space;\mathbf{B}_j&amp;space;\mathbf{x}(t-\tau_j)+\mathbf{c}\right)\mathrm{d}t&amp;space;+&amp;space;\sum_{k=1}^w\left(\boldsymbol{\alpha}^k&amp;space;\mathbf{x}(t)&amp;space;+&amp;space;\sum_{j=1}^g&amp;space;\boldsymbol{\beta}^k_j&amp;space;\mathbf{x}(t-\tau_j)&amp;space;+&amp;space;\boldsymbol{\sigma}^k&amp;space;\right)\mathrm{d}W^k(t)$$" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>

<p>by transforming the underlying differential equation into the stochastic mapping:</p>

<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://camo.githubusercontent."><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent." title="$$\mathbf{y}_{n+1} = \left(\mathbf{F}_n+\sum_{k=1}^w\mathbf{G}^k_n\right)\mathbf{y}_n + \left(\mathbf{f}_n + \sum_{k=1}^w\mathbf{g}^k_n\right),$$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$$\mathbf{y}_{n+1}&amp;space;=&amp;space;\left(\mathbf{F}_n+\sum_{k=1}^w\mathbf{G}^k_n\right)\mathbf{y}_n&amp;space;+&amp;space;\left(\mathbf{f}_n&amp;space;+&amp;space;\sum_{k=1}^w\mathbf{g}^k_n\right),$$" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p>where 
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=n" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/4a00e56fc2ccd1bb76181b4377c2a360feef878f/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f6e" title="n" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?n" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
is the discrete time 
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=(t_n&amp;space;=&amp;space;n&amp;space;\Delta&amp;space;t)" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/7621d246d6aa7ac1957defc2a69a0cb000f0ff42/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f28745f6e2673706163653b3d2673706163653b6e2673706163653b5c44656c74612673706163653b7429" title="(t_n = n \Delta t)" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?(t_n&amp;space;=&amp;space;n&amp;space;\Delta&amp;space;t)" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
, 
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\mathbf{F}_n" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/a5b30adbd5b67f5c5eab42eea18b520ec53bdef7/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f5c6d61746862667b467d5f6e" title="\mathbf{F}_n" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\mathbf{F}_n" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
is the deterministic mapping matrix constructed using 
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\mathbf{A}" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/6f857d654f3d4d8b31518fddcb551887e0a9b9da/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f5c6d61746862667b417d" title="\mathbf{A}" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\mathbf{A}" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
, 
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\mathbf{B}" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/430c74f0185e46bb0a87d96d9aefa56af3f11fc6/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f5c6d61746862667b427d" title="\mathbf{B}" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\mathbf{B}" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
and 
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\tau_j" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/bc0b5844680cf7a8232d39bac106424392f2eaf6/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f5c7461755f6a" title="\tau_j" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\tau_j" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
, 
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\mathbf{G}^k_n" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/fb8e841d03c1db41a04213a9c34b5d49969ef309/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f5c6d61746862667b477d5e6b5f6e" title="\mathbf{G}^k_n" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\mathbf{G}^k_n" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
are the stochastic mapping matrices constructed using 
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\boldsymbol{\alpha}" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/fb7a3cd2e092401946aea997eaed8d72e41d2c31/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f5c626f6c6473796d626f6c7b5c616c7068617d" title="\boldsymbol{\alpha}" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\boldsymbol{\alpha}" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
, 
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\boldsymbol{\beta}" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/54f841ecb6ff979239cc9424c65f797a8f412ab3/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f5c626f6c6473796d626f6c7b5c626574617d" title="\boldsymbol{\beta}" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\boldsymbol{\beta}" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
and 
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\tau_j" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/bc0b5844680cf7a8232d39bac106424392f2eaf6/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f5c7461755f6a" title="\tau_j" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\tau_j" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
, 
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\mathbf{f}_n" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/482a9440cf41c8b70536cc20618bcd526c5f4594/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f5c6d61746862667b667d5f6e" title="\mathbf{f}_n" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\mathbf{f}_n" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
and 
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\mathbf{g}^k_n" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/6f3f1fc81f33ebe64934fb74318da365b0feb153/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f5c6d61746862667b677d5e6b5f6e" title="\mathbf{g}^k_n" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\mathbf{g}^k_n" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
are the deterministic and stochastic additive vectors, constructed using 
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\mathbf{c}" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/4c13e04e46ff8b5971738ada314d4a70093b3c44/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f5c6d61746862667b637d" title="\mathbf{c}" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\mathbf{c}" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
and 
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\boldsymbol{\sigma}^k" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/8a52df0a9977a4d2b73d79113d6ab9d81f0808b5/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f5c626f6c6473796d626f6c7b5c7369676d617d5e6b" title="\boldsymbol{\sigma}^k" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\boldsymbol{\sigma}^k" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
, respectively.
The vector 
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\mathbf{y}_n" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/28f1a79bb30fc09c690725beb463514426aafc52/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f5c6d61746862667b797d5f6e" title="\mathbf{y}_n" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\mathbf{y}_n" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
is the discretized state space vector:</p>

<p><a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\mathbf{y}_n&amp;space;=&amp;space;\left(\mathbf{x}(t_n)^\top,&amp;space;\mathbf{x}(t_{n-1})^\top,\ldots,\mathbf{x}(t_{n-r})\right)^\top\!." rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent." title="\mathbf{y}_n = \left(\mathbf{x}(t_n)^\top, \mathbf{x}(t_{n-1})^\top,\ldots,\mathbf{x}(t_{n-r})\right)^\top\!." data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\mathbf{y}_n&amp;space;=&amp;space;\left(\mathbf{x}(t_n)^\top,&amp;space;\mathbf{x}(t_{n-1})^\top,\ldots,\mathbf{x}(t_{n-r})\right)^\top\!." style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p>The first moment dynamics is described by the expected value of the stochastic mapping, leading to a deterministic mapping:</p>

<p><a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\mathbb{E}\left(\mathbf{y}_{n+1}\right)&amp;space;=&amp;space;\mathbf{F}_n\mathbb{E}\left(\mathbf{y}_n\right)+\mathbf{f}_n," rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent." title="\mathbb{E}\left(\mathbf{y}_{n+1}\right) = \mathbf{F}_n\mathbb{E}\left(\mathbf{y}_n\right)+\mathbf{f}_n," data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\mathbb{E}\left(\mathbf{y}_{n+1}\right)&amp;space;=&amp;space;\mathbf{F}_n\mathbb{E}\left(\mathbf{y}_n\right)+\mathbf{f}_n," style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p>while the second moment dynamics is described by the expected value of the outer product of the mapping:</p>

<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://camo.githubusercontent."><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent." title="$$\mathbf{M}_n = \mathbb{E}\left(\mathbf{y}_n \mathbf{y}_n^\top\right), \quad \Rightarrow \quad \mathbf{m}_n = \mathrm{vec}\left(\mathbf{M}_n\right) := \left[ M_{n,11},M_{n,22},\dots ,M_{n,12},M_{n,23},\dots,M_{n,1,\left(r+1\right)d} \right]^\top,$$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$$\mathbf{M}_n&amp;space;=&amp;space;\mathbb{E}\left(\mathbf{y}_n&amp;space;\mathbf{y}_n^\top\right),&amp;space;\quad&amp;space;\Rightarrow&amp;space;\quad&amp;space;\mathbf{m}_n&amp;space;=&amp;space;\mathrm{vec}\left(\mathbf{M}_n\right)&amp;space;:=&amp;space;\left[&amp;space;M_{n,11},M_{n,22},\dots&amp;space;,M_{n,12},M_{n,23},\dots,M_{n,1,\left(r+1\right)d}&amp;space;\right]^\top,$$" style="max-width:100%;"></a><br></p>

<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://camo.githubusercontent."><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent." title="$$\mathbf{m}_{n+1} =\mathbf{H}_n\,\mathbf{m}_{n}+\mathbf{h}_{1,n}\mathbb{E}\left(\mathbf{y}_n\right)+\mathbf{h}_n,$$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$$\mathbf{m}_{n+1}&amp;space;=\mathbf{H}_n\,\mathbf{m}_{n}+\mathbf{h}_{1,n}\mathbb{E}\left(\mathbf{y}_n\right)+\mathbf{h}_n,$$" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p>where coefficient matrice
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=$\mathbf{H}_n$" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/1fa847aa793f0b46414a92eeb0f3633d7a0535d6/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f245c6d61746862667b487d5f6e24" title="$\mathbf{H}_n$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$\mathbf{H}_n$" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
,
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=$\mathbf{h}_{1,n}$" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/3c81cdf923b87cf4af7840b92d543a8e6a0e08a4/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f245c6d61746862667b687d5f7b312c6e7d24" title="$\mathbf{h}_{1,n}$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$\mathbf{h}_{1,n}$" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
and additive vector
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=$\mathbf{h}_n$" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/3b605d57c16a8f53290d81d9ae7f03b8559d7f20/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f245c6d61746862667b687d5f6e24" title="$\mathbf{h}_n$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$\mathbf{h}_n$" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
are constructed using the mapping matrices
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=$\mathbf{F}_n$" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/9ef741cfd562916e29f18f40c9f7c6df7ae2e061/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f245c6d61746862667b467d5f6e24" title="$\mathbf{F}_n$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$\mathbf{F}_n$" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
,
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=$\mathbf{G}^k_n$" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/cd8137cd6de9e03ce7cd2a6dd0a300c47fd966ba/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f245c6d61746862667b477d5e6b5f6e24" title="$\mathbf{G}^k_n$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$\mathbf{G}^k_n$" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
and vectors
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=$\mathbf{f}_n$" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/3dff5d533a5c4d8258acabce1183fed7120ada07/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f245c6d61746862667b667d5f6e24" title="$\mathbf{f}_n$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$\mathbf{f}_n$" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
,
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=$\mathbf{g}^k_n$" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/b6284f1fe5659d79780d486895978eeb0b324dfa/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f245c6d61746862667b677d5e6b5f6e24" title="$\mathbf{h}^k_n$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$\mathbf{g}^k_n$" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
, respectively. Note, that since the coefficient matrices of the original system are constant, the statistical properties of the coefficient matrices and additive vectors, hence the matrices
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=$\mathbf{F}_n$" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/9ef741cfd562916e29f18f40c9f7c6df7ae2e061/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f245c6d61746862667b467d5f6e24" title="$\mathbf{F}_n$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$\mathbf{F}_n$" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
,
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=$\mathbf{H}_n$" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/1fa847aa793f0b46414a92eeb0f3633d7a0535d6/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f245c6d61746862667b487d5f6e24" title="$\mathbf{H}_n$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$\mathbf{H}_n$" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
,
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=$\mathbf{h}_{1,n}$" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/3c81cdf923b87cf4af7840b92d543a8e6a0e08a4/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f245c6d61746862667b687d5f7b312c6e7d24" title="$\mathbf{h}_{1,n}$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$\mathbf{h}_{1,n}$" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
and vectors
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\mathbf{f}_n" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/482a9440cf41c8b70536cc20618bcd526c5f4594/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f5c6d61746862667b667d5f6e" title="\mathbf{f}_n" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\mathbf{f}_n" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
,
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\mathbf{h}_n" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/b777e06b6eb8d7ba44f3f32eb9a2f7e75ef4fba8/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f5c6d61746862667b687d5f6e" title="\mathbf{h}_n" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\mathbf{h}_n" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
are also constant.</p>
<p>The integer
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=r" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/74441022d86d5e48e437b03e9cc14973e9bf42ee/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f72" title="r" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?r" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
is chosen in a way, that 
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\inline&amp;space;r\Delta&amp;space;t\geq&amp;space;\max_{t&amp;space;\in&amp;space;\left[0,P\right],j=1\ldots&amp;space;g}\tau_j(t)" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent." title="r\Delta t\geq \max_{t \in \left[0,P\right],j=1\ldots g}\tau_j(t)" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\inline&amp;space;r\Delta&amp;space;t\geq&amp;space;\max_{t&amp;space;\in&amp;space;\left[0,P\right],j=1\ldots&amp;space;g}\tau_j(t)" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
(the discretized "history function" contains all possible delayed values) and 
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=d" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/a9441c067b8389cfff3cccce033e3251a198017c/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f64" title="d" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?d" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
is the dimension of the state space 
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\left(\mathbf{x}(t)&amp;space;\in&amp;space;\mathbb{R}^d\right)" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/3f01a731dfcafde137db15940f6bcf0c6cb4de70/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f5c6c656674285c6d61746862667b787d2874292673706163653b5c696e2673706163653b5c6d61746862627b527d5e645c726967687429" title="\left(\mathbf{x}(t) \in \mathbb{R}^d\right)" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\left(\mathbf{x}(t)&amp;space;\in&amp;space;\mathbb{R}^d\right)" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
.</p>






<p>With the use of the discrete mappings, the moment stability of the original system can be investigated (approximately), by the spectral radius 
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\rho" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/a100c640b3f60c4c267f7e52c3df4ecf0a2b8770/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f5c72686f" title="\rho" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\rho" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
of the coefficient matrices 
<a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\mathbf{F}_n" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/a5b30adbd5b67f5c5eab42eea18b520ec53bdef7/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f5c6d61746862667b467d5f6e" title="\mathbf{F}_n" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\mathbf{F}_n" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
over a period:</p>

<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://camo.githubusercontent."><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent." title="$$ \rho\left(\mathbf{F}_{n}\right) / \rho\left(\mathbf{H}_{n}\right) \left\{ \begin{matrix} &lt;1 &amp; \Rightarrow &amp; \text{the mapping is stable}\\ &gt;1 &amp; \Rightarrow &amp; \text{the mapping is unstable} \end{matrix} \right.$$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$$&amp;space;\rho\left(\mathbf{F}_{n}\right)&amp;space;/&amp;space;\rho\left(\mathbf{H}_{n}\right)&amp;space;\left\{&amp;space;\begin{matrix}&amp;space;&lt;1&amp;space;&amp;&amp;space;\Rightarrow&amp;space;&amp;&amp;space;\text{the&amp;space;mapping&amp;space;is&amp;space;stable}\\&amp;space;&gt;1&amp;space;&amp;&amp;space;\Rightarrow&amp;space;&amp;&amp;space;\text{the&amp;space;mapping&amp;space;is&amp;space;unstable}&amp;space;\end{matrix}&amp;space;\right.$$" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p>Furthermore, the stationary first and second moments can be determined as the fix points of corresponding moment mappings.</p>

<h1><a id="user-content-usage-with-examples" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#usage-with-examples"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Usage with examples</h1>
<h2><a id="user-content-installation" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#installation"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Installation</h2>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-julia"><pre>julia<span class="pl-k">&gt;</span> ] add StochasticSemiDiscretizationMethod</pre></div>
<h2><a id="user-content-stochastic-hayes-equations" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#stochastic-hayes-equations"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Stochastic Hayes equations</h2>

<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://camo.githubusercontent."><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent." title="$$\mathrm{d}{x}(t) = a \,x(t)\mathrm{d}t + \left(\beta \,x(t-1) + 1\right) \mathrm{d}W(t).$$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$$\mathrm{d}{x}(t)&amp;space;=&amp;space;a&amp;space;\,x(t)\mathrm{d}t&amp;space;+&amp;space;\left(\beta&amp;space;\,x(t-1)&amp;space;+&amp;space;1\right)&amp;space;\mathrm{d}W(t).$$" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p>Here</p>


<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://camo.githubusercontent."><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent." title="$$ \mathbf{A}(t) \equiv \begin{bmatrix} a \end{bmatrix}, \quad \mathbf{B}_1(t) \equiv \begin{bmatrix}0\end{bmatrix}, \quad \mathbf{c}(t) \equiv \begin{bmatrix} 0 \end{bmatrix},$$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$$&amp;space;\mathbf{A}(t)&amp;space;\equiv&amp;space;\begin{bmatrix}&amp;space;a&amp;space;\end{bmatrix},&amp;space;\quad&amp;space;\mathbf{B}_1(t)&amp;space;\equiv&amp;space;\begin{bmatrix}0\end{bmatrix},&amp;space;\quad&amp;space;\mathbf{c}(t)&amp;space;\equiv&amp;space;\begin{bmatrix}&amp;space;0&amp;space;\end{bmatrix},$$" style="max-width:100%;"></a>." /&gt; <br>
<a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://camo.githubusercontent."><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent." title="$$ \boldsymbol{\alpha}^1(t) \equiv \begin{bmatrix} 0 \end{bmatrix}, \quad \boldsymbol{\beta}^1_1(t) \equiv \begin{bmatrix}\beta\end{bmatrix}, \quad \tau^1_1(t) \equiv 1 \quad \mathrm{and} \quad \boldsymbol{\sigma}^1(t) \equiv \begin{bmatrix} \sigma \end{bmatrix}.$$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$$&amp;space;\boldsymbol{\alpha}^1(t)&amp;space;\equiv&amp;space;\begin{bmatrix}&amp;space;0&amp;space;\end{bmatrix},&amp;space;\quad&amp;space;\boldsymbol{\beta}^1_1(t)&amp;space;\equiv&amp;space;\begin{bmatrix}\beta\end{bmatrix},&amp;space;\quad&amp;space;\tau^1_1(t)&amp;space;\equiv&amp;space;1&amp;space;\quad&amp;space;\mathrm{and}&amp;space;\quad&amp;space;\boldsymbol{\sigma}^1(t)&amp;space;\equiv&amp;space;\begin{bmatrix}&amp;space;\sigma&amp;space;\end{bmatrix}.$$" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p>(First example in paper [1])</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-julia"><pre><span class="pl-k">using</span> StochasticSemiDiscretizationMethod</pre></div>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-julia"><pre><span class="pl-k">function</span> <span class="pl-en">createHayesProblem</span>(a,Œ≤)
    AMx <span class="pl-k">=</span>  <span class="pl-c1">ProportionalMX</span>(a<span class="pl-k">*</span><span class="pl-c1">ones</span>(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>));
    œÑ<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1.</span> 
    BMx1 <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">DelayMX</span>(œÑ<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">zeros</span>(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>));
    cVec <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">Additive</span>(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>)
    noiseID <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span>
    Œ±Mx1 <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">stCoeffMX</span>(noiseID,<span class="pl-c1">ProportionalMX</span>(<span class="pl-c1">zeros</span>(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>)))
    Œ≤Mx11 <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">stCoeffMX</span>(noiseID,<span class="pl-c1">DelayMX</span>(œÑ<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,Œ≤<span class="pl-k">*</span><span class="pl-c1">ones</span>(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>)))
    œÉ <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">stAdditive</span>(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">Additive</span>(<span class="pl-c1">ones</span>(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>)))
    <span class="pl-c1">LDDEProblem</span>(AMx,[BMx1],[Œ±Mx1],[Œ≤Mx11],cVec,[œÉ])
<span class="pl-k">end</span></pre></div>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-julia"><pre>hayes_lddep<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">createHayesProblem</span>(<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">6.</span>,<span class="pl-c1">2.</span>); <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> LDDE problem for Hayes equation</span>
method<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">SemiDiscretization</span>(<span class="pl-c1">0</span>,<span class="pl-c1">0.1</span>) <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> 0th order semi discretization with Œît=0.1</span>
œÑmax<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1.</span> <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> the largest œÑ of the system</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Second Moment mapping</span>
mapping<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">DiscreteMapping_M2</span>(hayes_lddep,method,œÑmax,n_steps<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">10</span>,calculate_additive<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">true</span>); <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>The discrete mapping of the system</span></pre></div>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-julia"><pre><span class="pl-c1">@show</span> <span class="pl-c1">spectralRadiusOfMapping</span>(mapping); <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> spectral radius œÅ of the mapping matrix (œÅ&gt;1 unstable, œÅ&lt;1 stable)</span>
statM2<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">VecToCovMx</span>(<span class="pl-c1">fixPointOfMapping</span>(mapping), <span class="pl-c1">length</span>(mapping<span class="pl-k">.</span>M1_Vs[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>])); <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> stationary second moment matrix of the hayes equation (equilibrium position)</span>
<span class="pl-c1">@show</span> statM2[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>]

<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> spectralRadiusOfMapping(mapping) = 0.3835887415448961</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> statM2[1,1] = 0.12505625506304247</span></pre></div>
<h3><a id="user-content-stability-borders-of-the-hayes-equation" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#stability-borders-of-the-hayes-equation"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Stability borders of the Hayes Equation</h3>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-julia"><pre><span class="pl-k">using</span> MDBM
<span class="pl-k">using</span> Plots
<span class="pl-c1">gr</span>();
<span class="pl-k">using</span> LaTeXStrings</pre></div>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-julia"><pre>method<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">SemiDiscretization</span>(<span class="pl-c1">0</span>,<span class="pl-c1">0.1</span>);
œÑmax<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1.</span>

<span class="pl-en">foo</span>(a,b) <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">log</span>(<span class="pl-c1">spectralRadiusOfMapping</span>(<span class="pl-c1">DiscreteMapping_M2</span>(<span class="pl-c1">createHayesProblem</span>(a,b),method,œÑmax,
    n_steps<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">10</span>))); <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> No additive term calculated</span>

axis<span class="pl-k">=</span>[<span class="pl-c1">Axis</span>(<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">9.0</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-c1">1.0</span>,<span class="pl-c1">:a</span>),
    <span class="pl-c1">Axis</span>(<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">5.0</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-c1">5.0</span>,:Œ≤)]

iteration<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">4</span>;
stab_border_points<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">getinterpolatedsolution</span>(<span class="pl-c1">solve!</span>(<span class="pl-c1">MDBM_Problem</span>(foo,axis),iteration));

<span class="pl-c1">scatter</span>(stab_border_points<span class="pl-k">...</span>,xlim<span class="pl-k">=</span>(<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">9.</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1.</span>),ylim<span class="pl-k">=</span>(<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">5.</span>,<span class="pl-c1">5.</span>),
    label<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,title<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>2nd moment stability border of the Hayes equation<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,xlabel<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds"><span class="pl-c1">L</span>"</span>A<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,ylabel<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds"><span class="pl-c1">L</span>"</span>$<span class="pl-cce">\b</span>eta$<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,
    guidefontsize<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">14</span>,tickfont <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">font</span>(<span class="pl-c1">10</span>),markersize<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span>,markerstrokewidth<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">0</span>)</pre></div>
<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="./assets/StochHayesM2.png"><img src="./assets/StochHayesM2.png" alt="" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<h2><a id="user-content-stochastic-linear-delay-oscillator" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#stochastic-linear-delay-oscillator"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Stochastic Linear Delay Oscillator</h2>

<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/58d274b5736e986691a73440234b572e38e81bb9/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f24245c646f747b787d2874292673706163653b3d2673706163653b762874292424"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/58d274b5736e986691a73440234b572e38e81bb9/68747470733a2f2f6c617465782e636f6465636f67732e636f6d2f6769662e6c617465783f24245c646f747b787d2874292673706163653b3d2673706163653b762874292424" title="$$\dot{x}(t) = v(t)$$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$$\dot{x}(t)&amp;space;=&amp;space;v(t)$$" style="max-width:100%;"></a><br>
<a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://camo.githubusercontent."><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent." title="$$\dot{v}(t) + 2\zeta v(t) + A x(t) = B x(t-2\pi) + \left(\alpha x(t) + \beta x(t-2\pi) + \sigma\right)\Gamma(t)$$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$$\dot{v}(t)&amp;space;+&amp;space;2\zeta&amp;space;v(t)&amp;space;+&amp;space;A&amp;space;x(t)&amp;space;=&amp;space;B&amp;space;x(t-2\pi)&amp;space;+&amp;space;\left(\alpha&amp;space;x(t)&amp;space;+&amp;space;\beta&amp;space;x(t-2\pi)&amp;space;+&amp;space;\sigma\right)\Gamma(t)$$" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p>Here</p>

<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://camo.githubusercontent."><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent." title="$$ \mathbf{x}(t) = \begin{bmatrix} x(t) \\ v(t) \end{bmatrix}, \quad \mathbf{A}(t) \equiv \begin{bmatrix} 0 &amp; 1 \\ -A &amp; -2\zeta \end{bmatrix}, \quad \tau^1_1(t) \equiv 2\pi, \quad \mathbf{B}_1(t) \equiv \begin{bmatrix}0 &amp; 0\\ B &amp; 0\end{bmatrix}, \quad \mathbf{c}(t) \equiv \begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ 0 \end{bmatrix},$$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$$&amp;space;\mathbf{x}(t)&amp;space;=&amp;space;\begin{bmatrix}&amp;space;x(t)&amp;space;\\&amp;space;v(t)&amp;space;\end{bmatrix},&amp;space;\quad&amp;space;\mathbf{A}(t)&amp;space;\equiv&amp;space;\begin{bmatrix}&amp;space;0&amp;space;&amp;&amp;space;1&amp;space;\\&amp;space;-A&amp;space;&amp;&amp;space;-2\zeta&amp;space;\end{bmatrix},&amp;space;\quad&amp;space;\tau^1_1(t)&amp;space;\equiv&amp;space;2\pi,&amp;space;\quad&amp;space;\mathbf{B}_1(t)&amp;space;\equiv&amp;space;\begin{bmatrix}0&amp;space;&amp;&amp;space;0\\&amp;space;B&amp;space;&amp;&amp;space;0\end{bmatrix},&amp;space;\quad&amp;space;\mathbf{c}(t)&amp;space;\equiv&amp;space;\begin{bmatrix}&amp;space;0&amp;space;\\&amp;space;0&amp;space;\end{bmatrix},$$" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<br>
<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://camo.githubusercontent."><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent." title="$$ \boldsymbol{\alpha}^1(t) \equiv \begin{bmatrix} 0 &amp; 0 \\ \alpha &amp; 0 \end{bmatrix}, \quad \tau^1_1(t) \equiv 2\pi \quad \boldsymbol{\beta}^1_1(t) \equiv \begin{bmatrix} 0 &amp; 0 \\ \beta &amp; 0\end{bmatrix}, \quad \mathrm{and} \quad \boldsymbol{\sigma}^1(t) \equiv \begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ \sigma\end{bmatrix}.$$" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?$$&amp;space;\boldsymbol{\alpha}^1(t)&amp;space;\equiv&amp;space;\begin{bmatrix}&amp;space;0&amp;space;&amp;&amp;space;0&amp;space;\\&amp;space;\alpha&amp;space;&amp;&amp;space;0&amp;space;\end{bmatrix},&amp;space;\quad&amp;space;\tau^1_1(t)&amp;space;\equiv&amp;space;2\pi&amp;space;\quad&amp;space;\boldsymbol{\beta}^1_1(t)&amp;space;\equiv&amp;space;\begin{bmatrix}&amp;space;0&amp;space;&amp;&amp;space;0&amp;space;\\&amp;space;\beta&amp;space;&amp;&amp;space;0\end{bmatrix},&amp;space;\quad&amp;space;\mathrm{and}&amp;space;\quad&amp;space;\boldsymbol{\sigma}^1(t)&amp;space;\equiv&amp;space;\begin{bmatrix}&amp;space;0&amp;space;\\&amp;space;\sigma\end{bmatrix}.$$" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p>(Second example in paper [1])</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-julia"><pre><span class="pl-k">function</span> <span class="pl-en">createSLDOProblem</span>(A,B,Œ∂,Œ±,Œ≤,œÉ)
    AMx <span class="pl-k">=</span>  <span class="pl-c1">ProportionalMX</span>(<span class="pl-c1">@SMatrix</span> [<span class="pl-c1">0.</span> <span class="pl-c1">1.</span>;<span class="pl-k">-</span>A <span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span>Œ∂]);
    œÑ<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span>œÄ 
    BMx1 <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">DelayMX</span>(œÑ<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">@SMatrix</span> [<span class="pl-c1">0.</span> <span class="pl-c1">0.</span>; B <span class="pl-c1">0.</span>]);
    cVec <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">Additive</span>(<span class="pl-c1">2</span>)
    noiseID <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span>
    Œ±Mx1 <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">stCoeffMX</span>(noiseID,<span class="pl-c1">ProportionalMX</span>(<span class="pl-c1">@SMatrix</span> [<span class="pl-c1">0.</span> <span class="pl-c1">0.</span>; Œ± <span class="pl-c1">0.</span>]))
    Œ≤Mx11 <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">stCoeffMX</span>(noiseID,<span class="pl-c1">DelayMX</span>(œÑ<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">@SMatrix</span> [<span class="pl-c1">0.</span> <span class="pl-c1">0.</span>; Œ≤ <span class="pl-c1">0.</span>]))
    œÉVec <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">stAdditive</span>(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">Additive</span>(<span class="pl-c1">@SVector</span> [<span class="pl-c1">0.</span>, œÉ]))
    <span class="pl-c1">LDDEProblem</span>(AMx,[BMx1],[Œ±Mx1],[Œ≤Mx11],cVec,[œÉVec])
<span class="pl-k">end</span></pre></div>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-julia"><pre>SLDOP_lddep<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">createSLDOProblem</span>(<span class="pl-c1">1.</span>,<span class="pl-c1">0.1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">0.1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">0.1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">0.1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">0.5</span>); <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> LDDE problem for Hayes equation</span>
method<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">SemiDiscretization</span>(<span class="pl-c1">5</span>,(<span class="pl-c1">2</span>œÄ<span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">100</span><span class="pl-c1">eps</span>())<span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">10</span>) <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> 5th order semi discretization with Œît=2œÄ/10</span>
œÑmax<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span>œÄ <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> the largest œÑ of the system</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Second Moment mapping</span>
mapping<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">DiscreteMapping_M2</span>(SLDOP_lddep,method,œÑmax,n_steps<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">10</span>,calculate_additive<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">true</span>); <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>The discrete mapping of the system</span>

<span class="pl-c1">@show</span> <span class="pl-c1">spectralRadiusOfMapping</span>(mapping); <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> spectral radius œÅ of the mapping matrix (œÅ&gt;1 unstable, œÅ&lt;1 stable)</span>
statM2<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">VecToCovMx</span>(<span class="pl-c1">fixPointOfMapping</span>(mapping), <span class="pl-c1">length</span>(mapping<span class="pl-k">.</span>M1_Vs[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>])); <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> stationary second moment matrix of the hayes equation (equilibrium position)</span>
<span class="pl-c1">@show</span> statM2[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>] <span class="pl-k">|&gt;</span> sqrt;

<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> spectralRadiusOfMapping(mapping) = 0.5059591707964441</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> statM2[1, 1] |&gt; sqrt = 0.9042071549857947</span></pre></div>
<h3><a id="user-content-stability-borders-of-the-delay-oscillator" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#stability-borders-of-the-delay-oscillator"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Stability borders of the Delay Oscillator</h3>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-julia"><pre>method<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">SemiDiscretization</span>(<span class="pl-c1">5</span>,<span class="pl-c1">2</span>œÄ<span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">30</span>);
œÑmax<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span>œÄ<span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">100</span><span class="pl-c1">eps</span>()
idxs<span class="pl-k">=</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">2</span>,<span class="pl-c1">3</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>(StochasticSemiDiscretizationMethod<span class="pl-k">.</span><span class="pl-c1">rOfDelay</span>(œÑmax,method)<span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>)<span class="pl-k">*</span><span class="pl-c1">2.</span><span class="pl-k">..</span>]

<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Œ∂=0.05, Œ±=0.3*A, Œ≤=0.3*B</span>
<span class="pl-en">foo</span>(A,B) <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">log</span>(<span class="pl-c1">spectralRadiusOfMapping</span>(<span class="pl-c1">DiscreteMapping_M2</span>(<span class="pl-c1">createSLDOProblem</span>(A,B,<span class="pl-c1">0.05</span>,<span class="pl-c1">0.3</span><span class="pl-k">*</span>A,<span class="pl-c1">0.3</span><span class="pl-k">*</span>B,<span class="pl-c1">0.</span>),method,œÑmax,idxs,
    n_steps<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">30</span>),nev<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">8</span>)); <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> No additive term calculated</span>

axis<span class="pl-k">=</span>[<span class="pl-c1">Axis</span>(<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1.0</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-c1">0.6</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-c1">5.0</span>,<span class="pl-c1">:A</span>),
    <span class="pl-c1">Axis</span>(<span class="pl-c1">LinRange</span>(<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1.5</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1.5</span>,<span class="pl-c1">12</span>),<span class="pl-c1">:B</span>)]

iteration<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">4</span>;
stab_border_points<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">getinterpolatedsolution</span>(<span class="pl-c1">solve!</span>(<span class="pl-c1">MDBM_Problem</span>(foo,axis),iteration));

<span class="pl-c1">scatter</span>(stab_border_points<span class="pl-k">...</span>,xlim<span class="pl-k">=</span>(<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1.</span>,<span class="pl-c1">5.</span>),ylim<span class="pl-k">=</span>(<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1.5</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1.4</span>),
    label<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,title<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>2nd moment stability border of the Delay Oscillator<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,xlabel<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds"><span class="pl-c1">L</span>"</span>A<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,ylabel<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds"><span class="pl-c1">L</span>"</span>$B$<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,
    guidefontsize<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">14</span>,tickfont <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">font</span>(<span class="pl-c1">10</span>),markersize<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span>,markerstrokewidth<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">0</span>)</pre></div>
